page.title: 08WEDGWOOD FACTORY, BARLASTON
page.content: Ornamenting is the next stage of making pottery. Ornamenters apply the figures to the ornament (e.g. vase). It takes two years to train to be an ornamenter. During firing the colours develop. The ornament turns blue and the figures turn white. Jasper shrinks 15% during firing, and bone china shrinks 5%. Lithographing is one of the ways of decorating. The transfers have a plastic backing on them , which are cut down to size and then gently put onto the ornament without air being trapped underneath. The plastic backing is burnt away during firing. It takes 6 months basic training to be a lithographer. Raised gold is another form of decorating. The gold that is used is real. One plate can cost 190 pounds. It takes 3 years training to learn how to raise gold.
